alert.note: Alert for Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 06 at 5:24AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS WILL CONTINUE DUE TO SNOWMELT AND PRECIPITATION... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will continue to see rises through early next week. Shower and thunderstorm activity is expected to decrease in frequency over the weekend, however a handful of locations are expected to remain above bankfull through early next week. The John Day River at Service Creek is still expected to reach moderate flood stage over the weekend as well. Shower and thunderstorm activity will be concentrated over the mountains today and Sunday, with a more widespread threat during the day Monday. Most recent gauge forecasts from the River Forecast Center still have rivers and streams cresting over the weekend, but this could be subject to change depending on how the forecast for Monday evolves. Stay tuned to the latest updates on the forecast over the next several days at weather.gov/pdt.

area.areaDesc: Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley
